docs.snippet: Max Schrems's crusade against the information collected by the social network has become a cause célèbre in parts of Europe, looming over the company as it prepares to go public....
docs.lead_paragraph: Max Schrems, a 24-year-old college student and a user of Facebook since 2008, has led a vocal campaign in Europe against what he maintains are Facebook's illegal practices of collecting and marketing users' personal data, reports Kevin J. O'Brien, for The New York Times. Mr. Schrems and his crusade has attracted the attention of lawmakers in Brussels as the Continent begins a lengthy debate over tough new proposed restrictions on personal data, which could affect Web businesses like Facebook.Read more »
docs.abstract: Max Schrems's crusade against the information collected by the social network has become a cause célèbre in parts of Europe, looming over the company as it prepares to go public.

headline.main: An Austrian Law Student Faces Down Facebook

docs.snippet: Mark Zuckerberg plans to exercise stock options with an estimated value of $5 billion ahead of Facebook's initial public offering, which will translate into a big tax benefit for the company....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mark Zuckerberg plans to exercise stock options with an estimated value of $5 billion ahead of Facebook's initial public offering, which will translate into a big tax benefit for the company, reports David Kocieniewski.Read more »
docs.abstract: Mark Zuckerberg plans to exercise stock options with an estimated value of $5 billion ahead of Facebook's initial public offering, which will translate into a big tax benefit for the company.

headline.main: Zuckerberg's Big Tax Bill May Benefit Facebook

docs.snippet: Facebook's S-1 filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission is the first step toward an initial public offering. DealBook is annotating the 148-page prospectus to decipher the giant social network's revenue, profit and risk factors....

docs.snippet: I clicked "Add Friend." He accepted within minutes. Stunned, I wondered if he had forgotten raping me....
docs.lead_paragraph: Facebook suggested I friend him. I guess our social networks overlapped. I guided the mouse toward his photo, and the little pointed hand hovered over his face. Fear and anger swelled up but curiosity won out and I clicked "Add Friend." He accepted within minutes. Stunned, I wondered if he had forgotten raping me, or if he thought I had.
docs.abstract: I clicked "Add Friend." He accepted within minutes. Stunned, I wondered if he had forgotten raping me.

docs.snippet: Customers who buy songs through Google's store will be able to recommend them to Google+ contacts, who can listen to them once and may be tempted to buy them....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google's plan for an MP3 store to rival iTunes and Amazon.com will be connected to its social network, Google+, and will allow users to share the music they buy with friends, according to four people with knowledge of Google's plans.
docs.abstract: Customers who buy songs through Google's store will be able to recommend them to Google+ contacts, who can listen to them once and may be tempted to buy them.

headline.main: Google Said to Add Social Element for Music

docs.snippet: A long-lost father resurfaces. Or does he?...
docs.lead_paragraph: A long-lost father resurfaces. Or does he?
docs.abstract: James Collins Op-Ed article, in light of Steve Jobs' decision never to meet his biological father, makes tongue-in-cheek claim that he is natural father of 'adopted' Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg.

docs.snippet: As videos continue to suggest a violent crackdown is continuing in Syria, Robert Ford, the American ambassador in Damascus, defended his outspoken criticism of President Bashar al-Assad's response to the protests....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two days after he attacked the Syrian government's violent response to peaceful protests in a blunt note posted on Facebook, Robert Ford, the American ambassador in Damascus, returned to the social network on Thursday to spar with some of his critics.
docs.abstract: As videos continue to suggest a violent crackdown is continuing in Syria, Robert Ford, the American ambassador in Damascus, defended his outspoken criticism of President Bashar al-Assad's response to the protests.

headline.main: U.S. Ambassador to Syria Responds to Critics on Facebook

docs.snippet: Once 100,000 viewers have clicked on a Levi’s ad to pledge support for Water.org, Levi’s will make a donation to the organization....
docs.lead_paragraph: Levi’s is adding a hue to its marketing efforts: Facebook blue. The purveyor of all things denim has teamed up with the social media giant on the next phase of its “Go Forth” campaign.
docs.abstract: Once 100,000 viewers have clicked on a Levi’s ad to pledge support for Water.org, Levi’s will make a donation to the organization.

headline.main: Levi’s Drive for Water.org via Facebook

headline.main: Facebook’s Safety Check, Now Automated, Turns a Firecracker Into an Explosion
